intro: Scorzonera tetuanensis, commonly known as the Tetuan scorpionroot, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Scorzonera tetuanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential pharmacological properties.
